metadata.title: CVE-2021-20232 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in gnutls. A use after free issue in client_send_params inlib/ext/pre_shared_key.c may lead to memory corruption and other potentialconsequences.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20232` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.6
guile-gnutls - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.6
libgnutls-dane0 - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.6
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.6
libgnutls30 - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.6
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.13-2ubuntu1.6').
